thread.title: UK GAS-Prompt prices hold broadly steady
thread.title_full: UK GAS-Prompt prices hold broadly steady

title: UK GAS-Prompt prices hold broadly steady
text:
* UK gas system undersupplied by 16 mcm 
* Outage cuts flows at North Morecambe sub-terminal 
July 21 (Reuters) - Wholesale prompt prices for gas in Britain held broadly steady on Tuesday although demand for storage injections and exports to Belgium left the system undersupplied. 
Gas for next-day delivery was trading down 0.10 pence at 43.85 pence per therm at 0945 GMT, while gas for immediate delivery was up 0.15 pence at 44.05 pence per therm. 
National Grid (LSE: NG.L - news ) data showed the system 16 million cubic metres (mcm) short, with demand forecast at 170 mcm and supply at 154 mcm. 
Strong exports to Belgium and storage injections kept demand 18 mcm above the seasonal norm, but strength in sterling and weak oil prices limited the upside in the near curve, traders said. 
Britain was expected to export 23 mcm to Belgium on Tuesday, while Rough storage was to inject 21 mcm, nominations showed. 
On the supply side, an unplanned outage cut gas output from Centrica (LSE: CNA.L - news ) 's North Morecambe sub-terminal early on Tuesday due to "offshore issues". 
Flows from the Barrow terminal complex, which includes the North Morecambe sub-terminal, were running at around 1 mcm/day compared with 5.2 mcm delivered on Monday. 
Norwegian gas flows into the FLAGS pipeline, which delivers to the St Fergus terminal in Scotland, have been reduced due to an ongoing outage. 
One LNG tanker is set to deliver a cargo from Qatar to the South Hook terminal on July 24, and another is expected on July 28. 
Gas for winter 2015 delivery edged down 0.20 pence to 46.15 pence per therm. 
In the Netherlands, the day-ahead price at the TTF hub was 2 cents lower at 21.08 euros per megawatt-hour. 
Europe's benchmark carbon price was 3 cents up at 8.02 euros per tonne on ICE Futures Europe. (Reporting by Nerijus Adomaitis in Oslo; Editing by Dale Hudson)
